Yes, there are several other buildings around the world that were designed to withstand extreme weather conditions. Here are a few examples:

1. The Burj Khalifa in Dubai: This tower was designed to withstand high winds and extreme temperatures. It has a tapered shape that helps to reduce wind pressure on the structure, and its cladding is made of reflective glass that can withstand the heat of the desert climate.

2. The Willis Tower in Chicago: This skyscraper was designed to withstand high winds, and it has a unique structural system that allows it to flex in the wind without causing damage. Its steel perimeter frame is designed to provide additional strength and stability.

3. The Shard in London: This building was designed to withstand high winds and seismic activity. It has a complex internal structure that provides stability and rigidity, and its cladding is made of energy-efficient glass that can withstand severe weather conditions.

4. The Marina Bay Sands in Singapore: This hotel and casino resort was designed to withstand extreme wind and rain, as well as seismic activity. Its iconic design includes a curved rooftop structure that helps to reduce wind pressure on the building.

Overall, these buildings and many others like them demonstrate the importance of designing structures that can withstand extreme weather conditions, and highlight the incredible creativity and ingenuity of architects and engineers in achieving these feats.
